intro: Dioscorea convolvulacea var. viridis, commonly known as green yam, is a variant of the yam plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a climbing vine with tuberous roots that are rich in starch and used as a food source. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its tubers are typically elongated and have a smooth, greenish skin. The botanical features of this variety make it well-suited for cultivation in warm climates.
